commitResults.messageBody:
Add simple echoing functionality to Waddles.
* Make Waddles echo user input until user enters "bye".
* Make Waddles' output left-padded for readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor: Makes Waddles not a singleton.
commitResults.messageBody:
Waddles is a singleton with only static methods.
This is unintentional, and can cause testability issues in the future.

We make all methods in Waddles non-static except for the main method.

commitResults.messageTitle: Support adding and listing user input
commitResults.messageBody: Make Waddles store all user input, and lists them on "list" command.

commitResults.messageTitle: Support marking tasks as done or undone
commitResults.messageBody:
Make Waddles support two new commands:
* mark <task_index>: To mark the task at that index as done.
* unmark <task_index>: To mark the task at that index as not done.

commitResults.messageTitle: Categorise tasks into todos, deadlines, and events
commitResults.messageBody:
When Waddles sees any input that is not a command, it treats it as
adding a new task. This is not very intuitive behaviour.

We make this behaviour explicit with respect to the new task types, by
adding support to Waddles for three new commands:
* todo <task description>
* deadline <task description> /by <deadline>
* event <task description> /from <start> /to <end>

Waddles supports a few different types of commands. Testing them
manually can be a chore.

We add a testcase in input.txt, so that we can use run.sh to check the
output of Waddles on those commands against the expected output.

User input is being parsed in each command handler in Waddles, leading
to repetitive code.

We create a new Parser class that helps us parse user input. This can
be extended in the future to catch parsing errors.

commitResults.messageTitle: Deal with errors in user input
commitResults.messageBody:
Users may enter their commands wrongly or miss out some arguments.

We add some checking and error handling in the form of exceptions.
Errors are printed to inform the user about what went wrong.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change commands from strings to enums
commitResults.messageBody:
Waddle's commands are represented as strings. This leads to multiple
sources of truth for a command's name scattered throughout the codebase.

We add a new Commands enum, and use that instead of strings.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update code formatting to follow Java style guide

commitResults.messageBody:
WaddlesException has a command field, which is echoed to the user on
error messages. This is useless as the user already knows what command
they typed.

We remove that field and tidy up WaddlesException.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Tasks class to store list of tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
An ArrayList is used to store the list of tasks. However, we want some
extra functionality, such as range checks on get() that throws an
appropriate WaddlesException.

We add a Tasks class here to replace ArrayList<Task>, so that we can
consolidate that functionality inside Tasks.

All tasks are lost when Waddles terminates. The user needs to re-enter
all their tasks each time they start up Waddles.

We add functionality to Waddles, such that it saves the task list to
disk after every command, and loads the task list from disk on startup.

commitResults.messageTitle: Use LocalDateTime instead of strings for date and times
Add WaddlesUi class for handling ui logic
Move all classes into a waddles package
Modify gradle build file to fit this project
Run auto formatter on all code files
Update constant names to be in screaming snake case
Update method names to be verbs
Fix formatting with IntelliJ auto formatter
Add functionality to Waddles to find tasks by keyword

commitResults.messageBody:
# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/waddles/Command.java
#	src/main/java/waddles/task/Task.java

commitResults.messageTitle: Add GUI to Waddles with JavaFX

commitResults.messageBody:
We make assumptions about the set of values that certain variables can
take in the codebase. This is documented with a warning, but violating
the assumption leads to uncontrolled behaviour.

We add asserts to ensure that these assumptions hold at runtime.

Some functions and expressions in the codebase are quite complicated.
This leads to poor readability.

We refactor some of the complexity to make it more readable.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor finding tasks with Java stream
commitResults.messageBody:
Finding tasks matching some description requires iterating through a
list of tasks and filtering. This is done with a for loop, but it is
not very descriptive.

We use Java streams instead of a for loop, so that the resulting code
is more readable.
Add assertions
Refactor to improve code quality
Refactor finding tasks with Java stream

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor command enum to make field final
commitResults.messageBody:
The invalid enum of command stores the given command. This functionality
is not used anywhere in the code, and prevents the name field from being
final.

We remove this functionality, such that the invalid enum now just stores
the name "invalid", and we can make the name field final.
